intro: Epilobium umbrosum, commonly known as shadowy willow herb, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that have a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are small, pink to purple, and arranged in spikes, blooming in late summer. Epilobium umbrosum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
